intro: Stenactis alpina, commonly known as the alpine stenactis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a composite head. Stenactis alpina is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
